alert.note: Alert for Accomack; Northampton (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 25 at 10:13PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Accomack and Northampton Counties through 1115 PM EDT... At 1013 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles west of Nassawadox, or 11 miles north of Cape Charles, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and frequent lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small trees and blow around unsecured objects. Wind impacting handling of high profile vehicles. Frequent cloud to ground lightning strikes. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Nassawadox around 1040 PM EDT. Exmore and Willis Wharf around 1050 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Simpkins, Birdsnest, Oyster, Jamesville, Silver Beach, Eastville, Quinby, Machipongo, Wardtown and Franktown. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
